column4: thanks for the link, but i have a feeling I am going to run into the same issue with this webite... I think its my hardware settings or something.
with screenshots! doesnt get easier than that :}
first time I installed I got a grub 18 error, so i reinstalled with a small boot partiton, unfortuantly it still sticks ... but it gets past grub :)
I took screen shots of mine too http://westrealm.homeip.net/shots/
the last image is where I stay.
you can also try in #ubuntu-server dont know if anyone is around though :}
the alternate cd will sometimes work when the livecd chokes; what are your system specs, esp ram and cpu
*, 1.1 Ghrz AMD 512 Ram, 16 MB graphics, trying to install server on an older BIOS. no luck
I can install easily, yes, it does boot the live cd, just fails to make it to the gui arthurARchnix, It usually fails after i install it (with no problems) first it failed on Grub 18 error.
then I created a small /boot partion, and it got past that error.
now it fails  just after grup.
yes, it had a 40 GB in there before, worked fine.
the bios allows for those drives? Jack_Sparrow suggested that earlier..
Jack_Sparrow, it sees the drives, when it installs it allows me to partition them... it lets me attempt to boot off them... I dont know anything past that.
